results.title: Greg Norman: the complete golfer. Part II: the short game
results.brief_description: Join ‘the Shark’ as he reveals his secrets of the short game; shots played from 75 yards in. Greg Norman goes through chipping, putting, playing from the sand bunker, all interspersed with prime, winning techniques from real tournament play.

results.title: Scotland: land of legends
results.creator_credit: Chip Duncan, Peter May, Susan Templin and International Video Network
results.brief_description: Narrated by John McIlwraith this video provides the viewer with an armchair guide of Scotland, land of legends. Explore the history of golf, visit Glasgow, the Barras, the rugged landscape of the Hebrides, Aberdeen, the River Tweed, Glenfiddich Distillery, Loch Ness, Urquhart Castle, and Dryburgh Abbey, resting place of Sir Walter Scott.

results.title: Cut your home heating costs
results.creator_credit: Barbara Anson, Dave Herman, John Hoskyns-Abrahall, Jeff Cox, Auska Videobooks and Rodale Press
results.brief_description: A two part program that looks at ways to cut your home heating costs. Pt 1. How to keep the heat in your house: Looks at where the most common energy leaks around the home are and how to halt heat loss with weather stripping, caulk, insulation, and window coverings. Pt 2. Wood heat: Examines how to start heating the home with wood. How to evaluate your home’s wood heating capacity, how to select the best stove, how to get more from your fireplace and how to maintain your stove safely are all examined. NB - forms for calculating energy use, mentioned in this video are not available in Australia.

results.title: An introduction to color mixing using the Liquitex Color Map
results.creator_credit: Binney and Smith, Art Products Division
results.brief_description: Russell Woody shows how to mix colour from a visual, rather than a theoretical perspective. Addresses how to select alternate colours to save money, how to correct failed colour mixes with minimal mixing, how to compare colours for opacity, outstanding coverage and transparency and glazes or washes. Provides an understanding of basic colour terms, how one colour can have several names, how words can distort colour vision and how to alleviate the problem.
results.title_for_label: An introduction to color mixing using the Liquitex Color Map

results.title: A Scenic harvest from the kingdom of pain
results.creator_credit: Joe Rees, Jonathan Reiss, IKON (GB) and Target Video
results.brief_description: Follows the performance art group Survival Research Laboratories and records three performances of the group. The setting up for a performance is shown, and interviews with some of the members of the group are conducted. The video also reports on whether injuries by the audience or performers were sustained.
results.title_for_label: A Scenic harvest from the kingdom of pain

results.title: Poland: a proud heritage
results.creator_credit: Andrew K Slodkowski, Chris Valentini and Hughes Leisure Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit Poland, the land of lakes, palaces, forests, cathedrals, sandy beaches and heroes and legends of the past. Visit the capital of Warsaw with its newly restored historical buildings. In Castle Square see the Royal Castle and Sigmund’s Column, the symbol of the city. Travel to Cracow’s Wawel Hill, the ancient seat of Polish kings and hear Polish folklore in the Tatras mountains. Experience the serenity of Bialowieza, Europe’s last virgin woodland. Pause in reflection at the Auschwitz Memorial, travel down the Dunajec River and visit the monastery of Jasna Gora, to see the Black Madonna.

results.title: The Divine Garbo
results.creator_credit: Susan F Walker, Ellen Krass and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: Garbo - the undefinable mystique. The most elusive, seductive and enigmatic actress the cinema has ever known, this Swedish star attracted audiences like no other. Her intense desire for privacy became legendary, vanishing from the screen - and the public - at the height of her commercial success. Hosted by actress Glenn Close, this video presents an insight to the mysterious Greta Garbo, including clips from such films as “Grand Hotel”, “Queen Christina”, “Anna Karenina”, “Camille” and “Ninotchka”, plus some rare behind-the-scenes glimpses, screen-test footage and foreign film clips - all of which only add to enhance the legend of one of Hollywood’s most elusive screen love goddesses.

results.title: Finland: fresh and original
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit unspoilt and unhurried Finland at the crossroads between East and West. Learn about the history of Finland and the Swedish influence on this country. Visit the Baltic port of Helsinki, Jyuaskyla and Finland’s second largest city at Tampere with it famous Lutheran cathedral. Step back in time in Turka with its handicraft museum and visit the Sibelius Museum. Travel north to the unspoilt wilderness of Lapland where the Lapps still tend herds of reindeer. Experience a sauna Finnish style.

results.title: Argentina: land of natural wonder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Geographically, Argentina (which is Spanish for “silver”) is the eighth largest country in the world. This colourful guided tour takes us through the highlights of Argentina’s landscape and history. From chilly Tierra del Fuego, the country’s southern-most region, to Aconcagua, the tallest mountain in the western hemisphere. Much of the program is devoted to the sweeping plains of Patagonia, home of the Argentinian cowboy - the gaucho. The video also introduces us to Argentinian wildlife, the beaches of Mar del Plata, the world’s only growing glacier, Perito Mereno and the sights and nightspots of Buenos Aires.

Much of the program is devoted to the sweeping plains of Patagonia, home of the Argentinian cowboy - the gaucho. The video also introduces us to Argentinian wildlife, the beaches of Mar del Plata, the world’s only growing glacier, Perito Mereno and the sights and nightspots of Buenos Aires.

results.title: 14 Days to Remember
results.creator_credit: Peter Hood, Bob Whittington and I T N
results.brief_description: A compilation of news footage covering historic events of the past thirty years: 1961 - East Germany builds the Berlin Wall; 1963 - U.S. President Kennedy is assassinated; 1968 - Soviet forces invade Czechoslovakia; 1969 - the first man on the moon; 1974 - the U.S. Watergate scandal; 1975 - the fall of Saigon ending the Vietnam War; 1980 - Iranian Embassy Siege; 1981 - the wedding of Britain’s Prince Charles and Lady Diana; 1982 - Britain invades the Falklands and wins back the islands; 1984 - the IRA attempt to blow up the entire British Cabinet meeting at Brighton; 1984 - Bhopal where poison gas leaks kill more than 3,000 Indians; 1986 - the Shuttle Disaster; 1986 - the Russian nuclear reactor at Chernobyl blows; 1988 - the tragedy of the Armenian earthquake.
